lines.text: [performing for Princess Lala's court as Scottish bagpipers, a humorous homage to her late Scottish father, MacTavish]
Say, Haggis!
What is it, MacBaggis?
Have you heard the latest about MacTavish?
What's he done now?
I heard he's living on the roof!
Why would he be living on the roof?
Because he heard someone say, "Drinks are on the house!"
He's gonna sing, folks. Now's the time to go out and get the popcorn.
[Harold has been caught in a tree snare, proving the island is inhabited]
I wonder what the locals are like?
I hope they're not cannibals or headhunters!
I hope they're orange pickers, I want to get out of this tree!
Oh, stop squawking, you'll fall off when you're ripe!
[George and Harold are surrounded by beautiful native women. Offstage voice shrieks "A-ough! Oh no!"]
What's that?
Oh, that's Errol Flynn. He can't stand it.
[One of the film's many cameos]
Look!
The African Queen! Humphrey Bogart?
Boy, is he lost!
Hey! Hey, Bogie!
[All three run toward Bogart]
Hey, jungle fever! That's what we got. That was just a mirage!
Oh yeah? What about this?
[Holding up a trophy]
Humphrey Bogart's Academy Award!
An Oscar! Gimme that, you got one. Friends, this is a great occasion, me receiving this Academy Award. And I'd like to say a word...
[roar from offstage]
Run!
That's the word!
You will *love* Vaatu. It is an island paradise.
Girls, huh?
Could it be paradise without girls?
Say, I haven't looked for work since I was night watchmen at Vassar
[a college for women only, until 1969]
Do you always fight over girls?
Well, what else can we fight over? We've never had any money
[Looking straight into the camera]
That's for Washington!
[a female ape has sat on Harold's lap]
Oh, buster, I don't like the look in her eye!
[the ape swings a paw at George]
George, get a rock, a club, anything! Kill one of us!
[George and Princess Lala pull Harold down]
This is the sloppiest hanging I ever attended!

[Caught in an animal trap and suspended in the air]
Get me down! My brain's rushing to my head.

[showing a portrait of a woman in regal dress]
She was my mother, Queen Tama of Vaatu.
Hm, beautiful.

[indicating the portrait next to it of a man in a kilt]
And he was my father.
Didn't anybody in the family wear the pants?

[whistles, indicating Lala's headdress with a golden spire]
This kid's got her own antenna.
Don't fool with the fun flute unless you consult with the master.
Let's get the sap out of the tree.
You collapsable Como!
Gridley, Harold Gridley- sportsman, raconteur, polo player, and all around good egg.

[as he and Harold wander through a flock of sheep]
Ya know, for a couple a guys on the lam, we're in pretty good company.
Is that the way all the natives dress on your island?
Nods
Really? George, do you suppose...
Not a chance.
Stick around folks, he could be wrong you know.
